targetString: Langkah-langkah pencegahan bagi mengurangkan kemungkinan jangkitan termasuklah tinggal di rumah, mengelakkan tempat orang ramai, kerap membasuh tangan dengan sabun dan air dan untuk sekurang-kurangnya 20 saat, mengamalkan kebersihan pernafasan yang baik dan mengelak daripada menyentuh mata, hidung atau mulut dengan tangan yang tidak dibasuh.
en-mt: Preventive measures to reduce the possibility of infection include staying at home, avoiding public places, washing hands frequently with soap and water and for at least 20 seconds, practicing good respiratory hygiene and avoiding touching the eyes, nose or mouth with contaminated hands. not washed

sourceString: The CDC recommends covering the mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing and recommends using the inside of the elbow if no tissue is available.
targetString: CDC mengesyorkan untuk menutup mulut dan hidung dengan tisu ketika batuk atau bersin dan mengesyorkan penggunaan bahagian dalam bahu sekiranya tiada tisu.
en-mt: The CDC recommends covering the mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing and recommends using the inside of the shoulder if a tissue is not available.

sourceString: Proper hand hygiene after any cough or sneeze is encouraged.
targetString: Kebersihan tangan yang betul selepas sebarang batuk atau bersin digalakkan.
en-mt: Proper hand hygiene after any cough or sneeze is encouraged.

sourceString: The CDC has recommended the use of cloth face coverings in public settings, in part to limit transmission by asymptomatic individuals.Social distancing strategies aim to reduce contact of infected persons with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, restricting travel and cancelling large public gatherings.
targetString: CDC mengesyorkan penggunaan penutup muka kain di tempat awam, sebahagiannya untuk membataskan pemindahan oleh individu yang asimptomatik. Strategi penjarakan sosial bertujuan untuk mengurangkan hubungan orang yang dijangkiti dengan kumpulan besar melalui penutupan sekolah dan tempat kerja, mengehadkan perjalanan dan membatalkan perhimpunan awam yang besar.
en-mt: The CDC recommends the use of cloth face coverings in public, in part to limit transmission by asymptomatic individuals. Social distancing strategies aim to reduce the contact of infected people with large groups by closing schools and workplaces, limiting travel and canceling large public gatherings.

sourceString: Distancing guidelines also include that people stay at least 6 feet (1.8 m) apart.
targetString: Garis panduan penjarakan juga termasuk untuk orang ramai berada sekurang-kurangnya 6 kaki (1.8 m) jauh antaranya.
en-mt: Social distancing guidelines also include keeping people at least 6 feet (1.8 m) apart.

sourceString: There is no medication known to be effective at preventing COVID-19.As a vaccine is not expected until 2021 at the earliest, a key part of managing COVID-19 is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as "flattening the curve".
targetString: Tiada ubat-ubatan yang dikenal pasti sebagai berkesan untuk menghalang COVID-19. Oleh kerana vaksin tidak dijangkakan sehingga paling awalnya tahun 2021, perkara utama dalam menguruskan COVID-19 ialah cuba mengurangkan puncak epidemik, dikenali sebagai "meratakan lekuk".
en-mt: There are no drugs that have been identified as effective in preventing COVID-19. As a vaccine is not expected until 2021 at the earliest, the key to managing COVID-19 is to try to reduce the peak of the epidemic, known as "flattening the curve".

sourceString: The CDC also recommends that individuals wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating and after blowing one's nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: CDC juga mengesyorkan bahawa individu kerap membasuh tangan dengan sabun dan air untuk sekurang-kurangnya 20 saat, terutamanya selepas pergi ke tandas atau ketika tangan nampak kotor, sebelum makan atau selepas menghembus hidung, batuk atau bersin.
en-mt: The CDC also recommends that individuals wash their hands frequently with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty, before eating or after blowing the nose, coughing or sneezing.

sourceString: It further recommends using an alcohol-based hand sanitiser with at least 60% alcohol, but only when soap and water are not readily available.For areas where commercial hand sanitisers are not readily available, the WHO provides two formulations for local production.
targetString: Lagi disyorkan untuk menggunakan pensanitasi tangan berasaskan alkohol dengan sekurang-kurangnya 60% alkohol tetapi hanya ketika sabun dan air tidak disediakan. Untuk kawasan yang tidak mempunyai pensanitasi tangan komersial, WHO menyediakan dua perumusan untuk pengeluaran tempatan.
en-mt: It is further recommended to use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol but only when soap and water are not available. For areas without commercial hand sanitizer, WHO provides two formulations for local production.

sourceString: In these formulations, the antimicrobial activity arises from ethanol or isopropanol.
targetString: Dalam perumusan ini, aktiviti antimikrob muncul dari etanol atau isopropanol.
en-mt: In this formulation, the antimicrobial activity appears from ethanol or isopropanol.

sourceString: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help eliminate bacterial spores in the alcohol; it is "not an active substance for hand antisepsis".
targetString: Hidrogen peroksida digunakan untuk membantu menyingkirkan spora bakteria dalam alkohol; ia "bukannya bahan aktif untuk antisepsis tangan".
en-mt: Hydrogen peroxide is used to help get rid of bacterial spores in alcohol; it is "not an active ingredient for hand antisepsis".

sourceString: Glycerol is added as a humectant.
targetString: Gliserol ditambah sebagai pelembap.
en-mt: Glycerol is added as a moisturizer.

sourceString: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.
targetString: Orang ramai diuruskan dengan penjagaan sokongan, yang mungkin termasuk terapi cecair, sokongan oksigen, dan menyokong organ penting terjejas yang lain.
en-mt: People are managed with supportive care, which may include fluid therapy, oxygen support, and supporting other affected vital organs.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that those who suspect they carry the virus wear a simple face mask.
targetString: CDC mengesyorkan bahawa sesiapa yang mengesyaki diri mereka membawa virus untuk memakai topeng muka yang mudah.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that anyone who suspects they are carrying the virus to wear a simple face mask.

sourceString: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) has been used to address the issue of respiratory failure, but its benefits are still under consideration.
targetString: Pengoksigenan membran esktrakorporeum (ECMO) digunakan untuk menangani isu kegagalan pernafasan, tetapi kelebihannya masih di bawah pertimbangan.
en-mt: Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) is used to address the issue of respiratory failure, but its advantages are still under consideration.

sourceString: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet have been recommended to improve immunity.
targetString: Kebersihan peribadi dan gaya hidup sihat dan diet disyorkan untuk meningkatkan imuniti.
en-mt: Personal hygiene and a healthy lifestyle and diet are recommended to boost immunity.

sourceString: Supportive treatments may be useful in those with mild symptoms at the early stage of infection.The WHO and Chinese National Health Commission have published recommendations for taking care of people who are hospitalised with COVID-19.
targetString: Rawatan sokongan mungkin berguna untuk mereka dengan gejala ringan pada tahap awal jangkitan. WHO dan Suruhanjaya Kesihatan Kesihatan China telah menerbitkan pengesyoran untuk menjaga mereka yang dimasukkan ke hospital dengan COVID-19.
en-mt: Supportive treatment may be useful for those with mild symptoms in the early stages of infection. The WHO and the Chinese Health Commission have published recommendations for the care of those hospitalized with COVID-19.

sourceString: Intensivists and pulmonologists in the U.S. have compiled treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.
targetString: Ahli penjagaan kritikal dan ahli pulmonologi di A.S. mengumpul pengesyoran rawatan daripada pelbagai agensi menjadi sumber percuma, IBCC.
en-mt: Critical care physicians and pulmonologists in the US aggregate treatment recommendations from various agencies into a free resource, the IBCC.

sourceString: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.
targetString: Setakat bulan April 2020, tiada rawatan khusus untuk COVID-19.
en-mt: As of April 2020, there is no specific treatment for COVID-19.

sourceString: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.
targetString: Untuk gejala, beberapa profesional perubatan mengesyorkan paracetamol (acetaminophen) berbanding ibuprofen untuk penggunaan garisan pertama.
en-mt: For symptoms, some medical professionals recommend paracetamol (acetaminophen) over ibuprofen for first-line use.

sourceString: Precautions must be taken to minimise the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.
targetString: Langkah berjaga-jaga hendaklah diambil untuk meminimumkan risiko pemindahan virus, terutamanya dalam tetapan penjagaan kesihatan apabila melaksanakan prosedur yang boleh menjana aerosol, seperti intubasi atau pengudaraan tangan.
en-mt: Precautions should be taken to minimize the risk of virus transmission, especially in healthcare settings when performing procedures that can generate aerosols, such as intubation or hand ventilation.

sourceString: For healthcare professionals caring for people with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions and airborne precautions.The CDC outlines the guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during the pandemic.
targetString: Untuk profesional penjagaan kesihatan menjaga mereka yang dijangkiti COVID-19, CDC mengesyorkan agar meletakkan orang itu dalam Bilik Pengasingan Jangkitan Bawaan (AIIR) sebagai tambahan dalam menggunakan langkah berjaga-jaga standard, langkah berjaga-jaga hubungan dan langkah berjaga-jaga bawaan. CDC menyediakan garis panduan untuk penggunaan peralatan perlindungan peribadi (PPE) semasa pandemik.
en-mt: For health care professionals caring for those infected with COVID-19, the CDC recommends placing the person in an Airborne Infection Isolation Room (AIIR) in addition to using standard precautions, contact precautions, and airborne precautions. The CDC provides guidelines for the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) during a pandemic.

sourceString: The recommended gear is: PPE gown, respirator or facemask, eye protection, and medical gloves.When available, respirators (instead of facemasks) are preferred.
targetString: Peralatan disyorkan ialah: gaun PPE, respirator atau topeng muka, pelindung mata dan sarung tangan perubatan. Sekiranya tersedia, respirator (berbanding topeng muka) lebih diutamakan.
en-mt: Recommended equipment is: PPE gown, respirator or face mask, eye protection and medical gloves. If available, a respirator (as opposed to a face mask) is preferred.

sourceString: N95 respirators are approved for industrial settings but the FDA has authorised the masks for use under an Emergency Use Authorisation (EUA).
targetString: Respirator N95 diluluskan oleh tetapan industri tetapi FDA sudah membenarkan topeng digunakan di bawah Kebenaran Penggunaan Kecemasan (EUA).
en-mt: N95 respirators are approved by industry settings but the FDA already allows masks to be used under an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA).

sourceString: They are designed to protect from airborne particles like dust but effectiveness against a specific biological agent is not guaranteed for off-label uses.
targetString: Ia direka untuk melindungi daripada partikel bawaan seperti habuk tetapi berkesan terhadap agen biologi khusus tidak terjamin untuk penggunaan luar label.
en-mt: It is designed to protect against airborne particles such as dust but effectiveness against specific biological agents is not guaranteed for off-label use.

sourceString: When masks are not available, the CDC recommends using face shields or, as a last resort, homemade masks.
targetString: Apabila topeng tidak boleh didapati, CDC mengesyorkan penggunaan pelindung muka atau sebagai pilihan akhir, topeng buatan sendiri.
en-mt: When a mask is not available, the CDC recommends the use of a face shield or as a last resort, a homemade mask.

sourceString: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical ventilation or alternatives, but a percentage of cases are.
targetString: Kebanyakan kes COVID-19 tidak teruk sehingga memerlukan ventilasi mekanikal atau alternatif, tetapi sesetengah peratusan memerlukannya.
en-mt: Most cases of COVID-19 are not severe enough to require mechanical or alternative ventilation, but a small percentage do.

sourceString: The type of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure is being actively studied for people in hospital, with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high flow nasal cannula or bi-level positive airway pressure.
targetString: Jenis sokongan pernafasan untuk individu dengan COVID-19 berkaitan dengan kegagalan pernafasan sedang dikaji secara aktif untuk pesakit di hospital dengan beberapa bukti bahawa intubasi boleh dielakkan dengan kanula hidung beraliran tinggi atau tekanan saluran udara positif dua tahap.
en-mt: Types of respiratory support for individuals with COVID-19 related respiratory failure are being actively studied for hospitalized patients with some evidence that intubation can be avoided with a high-flow nasal cannula or bilevel positive airway pressure.

sourceString: Whether either of these two leads to the same benefit for people who are critically ill is not known.
targetString: Sama ada kedua-dua ini memberikan manfaat sama kepada orang ramai yang sakit kritikal adalah tidak diketahui.
en-mt: Whether these two provide equal benefit to the critically ill population is unknown.

sourceString: Some doctors prefer staying with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to a high flow nasal cannula.Severe cases are most common in older adults (those older than 60 years, and especially those older than 80 years).
targetString: Beberapa doktor memilih untuk kekal dengan ventilasi mekanikal invasif sekiranya boleh didapati kerana teknik ini membataskan penyebaran partikel aerosol berbanding dengan kanula hidung aliran tinggi. Kes yang teruk biasanya kerap dalam kalangan dewasa lebih tua (mereka yang berusia lebih daripada 60 tahun dan terutamanya mereka yang berusia lebih daripada 80 tahun).
en-mt: Some physicians prefer to remain with invasive mechanical ventilation when available because this technique limits the spread of aerosol particles compared to high-flow nasal cannulae. Severe cases are more common in older adults (those over 60 and especially those over 80).

sourceString: Many developed countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits a health system's capacity to handle a sudden spike in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalisation.
targetString: Banyak negara membangun tidak mempunyai cukup katil hospital per kapita, yang membataskan kapasiti sistem kesihatan untuk mengendalikan peningkatan mendadak dalam jumlah kes COVID-19 yang cukup teruk memerlukan kemasukan hospital.
en-mt: Many developing countries do not have enough hospital beds per capita, which limits the capacity of health systems to handle a sudden increase in the number of COVID-19 cases severe enough to require hospitalization.

sourceString: One study in China found 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% needed mechanical support of ventilation, and 1.4% died.
targetString: Satu kajian di China mendapati seramai 5% yang dimasukkan ke unit penjagaan rapi, 2.3% memerlukan sokongan mekanikal ventilator dan 1.4% meninggal dunia.
en-mt: A study in China found that 5% were admitted to intensive care units, 2.3% required mechanical ventilator support and 1.4% died.

sourceString: In China, approximately 30% of people in hospital with COVID-19 are eventually admitted to ICU.
targetString: Di China, sekurang-kurangnya 30% pesakit di hospital dengan COVID-19 akan dimasukkan ke ICU pada akhirnya.
en-mt: In China, at least 30% of hospitalized patients with COVID-19 will eventually be admitted to the ICU.

sourceString: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complex as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.
targetString: Ventilasi mekanikal menjadi lebih rumit kerana sindrom distres respirasi akut (ARDS) membangun dalam COVID-19 dan pengoksigenan menjadi semakin sukar.
en-mt: Mechanical ventilation becomes more complicated as acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) develops in COVID-19 and oxygenation becomes increasingly difficult.

sourceString: Ventilators capable of pressure control modes and high PEEP are needed to maximise oxygen delivery while minimising the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.
targetString: Ventilator mampu mengawal tekanan dan PEEP tinggi diperlukan untuk memaksimumkan penyampaian oksigen sementara meminimumkan risiko kecederaan paru-paru berkaitan ventilator dan pneumotoraks.
en-mt: Ventilators are capable of pressure control and a high PEEP is required to maximize oxygen delivery while minimizing the risk of ventilator-associated lung injury and pneumothorax.

sourceString: High PEEP may not be available on older ventilators.
targetString: PEEP tinggi mungkin tidak tersedia pada ventilator lebih lama.
en-mt: High PEEP may not be available on longer ventilators.

sourceString: Research into potential treatments started in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.
targetString: Penyelidikan untuk rawatan berpotensi bermula pada Januari 2020, dan beberapa ubat-ubatan antivirus berada dalam percubaan klinikal.
en-mt: Research into potential treatments began in January 2020, and several antiviral drugs are in clinical trials.

sourceString: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.
targetString: Remdesivir muncul sebagai yang paling boleh diharapkan.
en-mt: Remdesivir appears to be the most promising.

sourceString: Although new medications may take until 2021 to develop, several of the medications being tested are already approved for other uses or are already in advanced testing.
targetString: Walaupun ubat-ubatan baharu mungkin mengambil masa sehingga 2021 untuk dibangunkan, beberapa ubat sedang diuji sudah diluluskan untuk kegunaan lain sudah berada dalam pengujian lanjutan.
en-mt: While new drugs may take until 2021 to be developed, some of the drugs being tested are already approved for use while others are already in advanced testing.

sourceString: Antiviral medication may be tried in people with severe disease.
targetString: Ubat-ubatan antivirus mungkin diuji pada orang ramai yang mengalami penyakit yang teruk.
en-mt: Antiviral drugs may be tested in people with severe disease.

sourceString: The WHO recommended volunteers take part in trials of the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments.The FDA has granted temporary authorisation to convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases where the person's life is seriously or immediately threatened.
targetString: WHO mengesyorkan sukarelawan mengambil bahagian dalam percubaan keberkesanan dan keselamatan rawatan yang berpotensi. FDA memberikan kebenaran sementara untuk plasma pemulihan sebagai rawatan eksperimen dalam kes untuk nyawa mereka yang serius atau mudah terancam.
en-mt: WHO recommends that volunteers participate in trials of potential treatment efficacy and safety. The FDA granted temporary approval for convalescent plasma as an experimental treatment in cases for those whose lives are seriously or easily threatened.

sourceString: It has not undergone the clinical studies needed to show it is safe and effective for the disease.
targetString: Ia belum lagi melalui kajian klinikal yang diperlukan untuk menunjukkan ia selamat dan berkesan untuk penyakit.
en-mt: It has not yet gone through the necessary clinical studies to show it is safe and effective for the disease.

sourceString: In February 2020, China launched a mobile app to deal with the disease outbreak.
targetString: Pada bulan Februari 2020, China melancarkan aplikasi mudah alih untuk menangani wabak penyakit.
en-mt: In February 2020, China launched a mobile application to deal with disease outbreaks.

sourceString: Users are asked to enter their name and ID number.
targetString: Pengguna diminta untuk memasukkan nama dan ID mereka.
en-mt: Users are asked to enter their name and ID.

sourceString: The app is able to detect 'close contact' using surveillance data and therefore a potential risk of infection.
targetString: Aplikasi ini boleh mengesan 'kenalan rapat" menggunakan data pengawasan dan dengan itu risiko jangkitan berpotensi.
en-mt: The app can detect "close contacts" using surveillance data and thus potential infection risks.

sourceString: Every user can also check the status of three other users.
targetString: Setiap pengguna boleh juga memeriksa status tiga pengguna lain.
en-mt: Each user can also check the status of three other users.

sourceString: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health officials.Big data analytics on cellphone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence are used to track infected people and people whom they contacted in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.
targetString: Jika risiko berpotensi dikesan, aplikasi bukan sahaja mengesyorkan kuarantin diri sendiri, ia juga memberi amaran kepada pihak berkuasa kesihatan tempatan. Analisis data besar ke atas data telefon selular, teknologi pengecaman wajah, penjejakan telefon mudah alih dan kecerdasan buatan digunakan untuk menjejak orang yang dijangkiti dan orang yang mereka berhubung di Korea Selatan, Taiwan dan Singapura.
en-mt: If a potential risk is detected, the app not only recommends self-quarantine, it also alerts local health authorities. Big data analysis of cellular phone data, facial recognition technology, mobile phone tracking and artificial intelligence were used to track infected people and the people they came in contact with in South Korea, Taiwan and Singapore.

sourceString: In March 2020, the Israeli government enabled security agencies to track mobile phone data of people supposed to have coronavirus.
targetString: Pada bulan Mac 2020, kerajaan Israel membolehkan agensi keselamatan untuk menjejak data telefon mudah alih mereka yang menghidapi koronavirus.
en-mt: In March 2020, the Israeli government allowed security agencies to track the mobile phone data of those suffering from the coronavirus.

sourceString: The measure was taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who may come into contact with infected citizens.
targetString: Langkah diambil untuk menguatkuasakan kuarantin dan melindungi mereka yang berhubungan dengan warganegara yang dijangkiti.
en-mt: Steps are taken to enforce quarantine and protect those who come into contact with infected citizens.

sourceString: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregated phone location data with the German federal government agency, Robert Koch Institute, in order to research and prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: Juga pada bulan Mac 2020, Deutche Telekom berkongsi data lokasi telefon agregat dengan agensi kerajaan persekutuan Jerman, Robert Koch Institute, untuk menyelidik dan mencegah penyebaran virus.
en-mt: Also in March 2020, Deutsche Telekom shared aggregate phone location data with a German federal government agency, the Robert Koch Institute, to research and prevent the spread of viruses.

sourceString: Russia deployed facial recognition technology to detect quarantine breakers.
targetString: Rusia melaksanakan teknologi pengecaman wajah untuk mengesan pesalah kuarantin.
en-mt: Russia implements facial recognition technology to track quarantine violators.

sourceString: Italian regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he has been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people are continuing to move around anyway".
targetString: Pesuruhjaya kesihatan wilayah Itali Giulio Gallera berkata beliau dimaklumkan oleh pengendali telefon mudah alih bahawa "40% orang ramai terus bergerak ke merata tempat".
en-mt: Italy's regional health commissioner Giulio Gallera said he had been informed by mobile phone operators that "40% of people continue to move everywhere".

sourceString: German government conducted a 48 hours weekend hackathon with more than 42.000 participants.
targetString: Kerajaan Jerman menjalankan hackathon hujung minggu 48 jam dengan lebih daripada 42,000 peserta.
en-mt: The German government ran a 48-hour weekend hackathon with more than 42,000 participants.

sourceString: Also the president of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid, made a global call for creative solutions against the spread of coronavirus.
targetString: Juga Presiden Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid menyeru kepada global untuk penyelesaian kreatif terhadap penularan koronavirus.
en-mt: Also the President of Estonia, Kersti Kaljulaid called on the world for a creative solution to the spread of the coronavirus.

sourceString: Individuals may experience distress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects of treatment or fear of the infection itself.
targetString: Individu mungkin mengalami tekanan akibat kuarantin, sekatan perjalanan, kesan daripada rawatan atau ketakutan terhadap jangkitan itu sendiri.
en-mt: Individuals may experience stress from quarantine, travel restrictions, side effects from treatment or fear of the infection itself.

sourceString: BBC quoted Rory O'Connor in saying, "Increased social isolation, loneliness, health anxiety, stress and an economic downturn are a perfect storm to harm people's mental health and wellbeing."
targetString: BBC memetik Rory O'Connor sebagai berkata. " Peningkatan pengasingan sosial, kesunyian, kebimbangan kesihatan, tekanan dan kemelesetan ekonomi ialah ribu sempurna yang membahayakan kesihatan mental orang ramai dan kesejahteraan."
en-mt: The BBC quoted Rory O'Connor as saying. "Increasing social isolation, loneliness, health concerns, stress and economic downturns are the perfect combination that endangers people's mental health and well-being."

sourceString: The disease may take a mild course with few or no symptoms, resembling other common upper respiratory diseases such as the common cold.
targetString: Penyakit akan menyebabkan kesan ringan dengan sedikit atau tiada gejala, menyerupai penyakit respirasi atasan biasa seperti selesema biasa.
en-mt: The disease will cause a mild effect with few or no symptoms, resembling a common upper respiratory disease such as the common cold.

sourceString: Mild cases typically recover within two weeks, while those with severe or critical diseases may take three to six weeks to recover.
targetString: Kes ringan biasanya sembuh dalam dua minggu, sementara mereka dengan penyakit teruk atau kritikal mengambil masa tiga atau enam minggu untuk sembuh.
en-mt: Mild cases usually heal in two weeks, while those with severe or critical illness take three or six weeks to heal.

sourceString: Pregnant women may be at higher risk for severe infection with COVID-19 based on data from other similar viruses, like SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 is lacking.In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.
targetString: Wanita hamil mungkin berisiko tinggi mendapat jangkitan COVID-19 yang teruk berdasarkan data daripada virus sama yang lain seperti SARS dan MERS, tetapi data untuk COVID-19 adalah kurang. Dalam beberapa orang, COVID-19 mungkin menjejaskan paru-paru yang menyebabkan pneumonia.
en-mt: Pregnant women may be at increased risk of severe COVID-19 infection based on data from other similar viruses such as SARS and MERS, but data for COVID-19 are lacking. In some people, COVID-19 may affect the lungs causing pneumonia.

sourceString: In those most severely affected, COVID-19 may rapidly progress to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.
targetString: Dalam kebanyakan mereka yang terjejas teruk, COVID-19 boleh melarat dengan cepat menjadi sindrom distres respiratori akut (ARDS) menyebabkan kegagalan respiratori, kejutan septik atau kegagalan berbilang organ.
en-mt: In many of those severely affected, COVID-19 can rapidly degenerate into acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) causing respiratory failure, septic shock or multi-organ failure.

sourceString: Complications associated with COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.
targetString: Komplikasi berkaitan dengan COVID-19 termasuk sepsis, pembekuan tidak normal dan kerosakan pada jantung, buah pinggang dan hati.
en-mt: Complications related to COVID-19 include sepsis, abnormal clotting and damage to the heart, kidneys and liver.

sourceString: Clotting abnormalities, specifically an increase in prothrombin time, have been described in 6% of those admitted to hospital with COVID-19, while abnormal kidney function is seen in 4% of this group.
targetString: Pembekuan tidak normal, khususnya peningkatan dalam masa protrombin, telah kelihatan jelas dalam seramai 6% daripada mereka yang dimasukkan ke dalam hospital dengan COVID-19, sementara fungsi buah pinggang tidak normal diperhatikan dalam 4% daripada kumpulan ini.
en-mt: Abnormal coagulation, particularly an increase in prothrombin time, was evident in as many as 6% of those hospitalized with COVID-19, while abnormal renal function was observed in 4% of this group.

sourceString: Approximately 20-30% of people who present with COVID-19 demonstrate elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).
targetString: Sekurang-kurangnya 20-30% orang ramai yang dijangkiti COVID-19 menunjukkan peningkatan enzim hati (transaminase).
en-mt: At least 20-30% of people infected with COVID-19 show elevated liver enzymes (transaminases).

sourceString: According to the same report, the median time between onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five being spent hospitalised.
targetString: Mengikut laporan yang sama, masa median antara permulaan gejala dan kematian ialah sepuluh hari, dengan lima hari diluangkan untuk kemasukan hospital.
en-mt: According to the same report, the median time between the onset of symptoms and death was ten days, with five days spent on hospitalization.

sourceString: However, patients transferred to an ICU had a median time of seven days between hospitalisation and death.
targetString: Bagaimanapun, pesakit dipindahkan ke ICU mempunyai masa median selama tujuh hari antara kemasukan hospital dan kematian.
en-mt: However, patients transferred to the ICU had a median time of seven days between hospital admission and death.

sourceString: In a study of early cases, the median time from exhibiting initial symptoms to death was 14 days, with a full range of six to 41 days.
targetString: Dalam kajian kes awal, masa median dari penunjukan gejala awal sehingga kematian ialah 14 hari, dengan liputan penuh enam sehingga 41 hari.
en-mt: In early case studies, the median time from initial symptom onset to death was 14 days, with full coverage of six to 41 days.

sourceString: In a study by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, men had a death rate of 2.8% while women had a death rate of 1.7%.
targetString: Dalam satu kajian oleh Suruhanjaya Kesihatan Kebangsaan (NHC) China, lelaki mempunyai kadar kematian sebanyak 2.8% sementara perempuan dengan kadar kematian sebanyak 1.7%.
en-mt: In a study by the National Health Commission (NHC) of China, males had a mortality rate of 2.8% while females had a mortality rate of 1.7%.

sourceString: Histopathological examinations of post-mortem lung samples show diffuse alveolar damage with cellular fibromyxoid exudates in both lungs.
targetString: Pemeriksaan histopatologi pada sampel paru-paru post-mortem menunjukkan kerosakan alveolus difus dengan fibromisoid selular eksudat dalam kedua-dua paru-paru.
en-mt: Histopathological examination of post-mortem lung samples showed diffuse alveolar damage with cellular fibromysoid exudates in both lungs.

sourceString: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in the pneumocytes.
targetString: Perubahan sitopati virus diperhatikan dalam pneumosit.
en-mt: Viral cytopathic changes were observed in pneumocytes.

sourceString: The lung picture resembled acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).
targetString: Gambar paru-paru menunjukkan sindrom distres respiratori akut (ARDS).
en-mt: A picture of the lungs shows acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).

sourceString: In 11.8% of the deaths reported by the National Health Commission of China, heart damage was noted by elevated levels of troponin or cardiac arrest.
targetString: Dalam 11.8% kematian dilaporkan oleh Suruhanjaya Kesihatan Kebangsaan China, kerosakan jantung diperhatikan dengan peningkatan tahap troponin atau kardium terhenti.
en-mt: In 11.8% of deaths reported by the National Health Commission of China, cardiac damage was observed with elevated troponin levels or cardiac arrest.

sourceString: According to March data from the United States, 89% of those hospitalised had preexisting conditions.Availability of medical resources and the socioeconomics of a region may also affect mortality.
targetString: Menurut data bulan Mac dari Amerika Syarikat, 89% daripada mereka yang dimasukkan ke dalam hospital dengan keadaan kesihatan sedia ada, Ketersediaan sumber perubatan dan sosioekonomi wilayah mungkin juga memberi kesan pada kadar kematian.
en-mt: According to March data from the United States, 89% of those hospitalized with pre-existing health conditions, Availability of medical resources and regional socioeconomics may also have an impact on mortality rates.

sourceString: Estimates of the mortality from the condition vary because of those regional differences, but also because of methodological difficulties.
targetString: Anggaran kadar kematian dari keadaan berbeza kerana perbezaan wilayah mereka, tetapi juga kerana kesukaran metodologi.
en-mt: Estimates of mortality rates from different conditions are due to their regional differences, but also due to methodological difficulties.

sourceString: The under-counting of mild cases can cause the mortality rate to be overestimated.
targetString: Kiraan bawah kes ringan boleh menyebabkan terlebih anggaran untuk kadar kematian.
en-mt: Undercounting of mild cases may lead to overestimation of mortality rates.

sourceString: However, the fact that deaths are the result of cases contracted in the past can mean the current mortality rate is underestimated.
targetString: Bagaimanapun, hakikatnya bahawa kematian ialah disebabkan oleh kes jangkitan pada masa lepas boleh bermakna kadar kematian semasa terlebih anggaran.
en-mt: However, the fact that deaths are due to past cases of infection may mean that the current death rate is overestimated.

sourceString: Smokers were 1.4 times more likely to have severe symptoms of COVID-19 and approximately 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die compared to non-smokers.Concerns have been raised about long-term sequelae of the disease.
targetString: Perokok mempunyai 1.4 kali lebih berkemungkinan mengalami gejala teruk COVID-19 dan mempunyai sekurang-kurangnya 2.4 lebih berkemungkinan memerlukan penjagaan rapi atau meninggal dunia berbanding dengan yang tidak merokok. Kebimbangan telah disuarakan mengenai susulan jangka panjang penyakit.
en-mt: Smokers are 1.4 times more likely to experience severe symptoms of COVID-19 and are at least 2.4 times more likely to require intensive care or die than non-smokers. Concerns have been voiced about the long-term follow-up of the disease.

sourceString: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found a drop of 20% to 30% in lung capacity in some people who recovered from the disease, and lung scans suggested organ damage.
targetString: Pihak Berkuasa Hospital Hong Kong mendapati penurunan sebanyak 20% sehingga 30% dalam keupayaan paru-paru dalam beberapa pesakit yang sembuh dari penyakit, dan imbasan paru-paru mencadangkan kerosakan organ.
en-mt: The Hong Kong Hospital Authority found a 20% to 30% drop in lung capacity in some patients who recovered from the disease, and lung scans suggested organ damage.

sourceString: This may also lead to post-intensive care syndrome following recovery.
targetString: Ini mungkin juga menjurus kepada sindrom selepas penjagaan rapi menuruti pemulihan.
en-mt: This may also lead to post-intensive care syndrome following recovery.

sourceString: As of March 2020, it was unknown if past infection provides effective and long-term immunity in people who recover from the disease.
targetString: Setakat Mac 2020, tidak diketahui jika jangkitan sebelum ini memberikan imuniti berkesan dan jangka panjang dalam mereka yang sembuh dari penyakit ini.
en-mt: As of March 2020, it is not known if previous infection confers effective and long-term immunity in those who recover from the disease.

sourceString: Immunity is seen as likely, based on the behaviour of other coronaviruses, but cases in which recovery from COVID-19 have been followed by positive tests for coronavirus at a later date have been reported.
targetString: Imuniti dilihat sebagai mungkin, berdasarkan tingkah laku koronavirus yang lain, tetapi dalam kes dengan pemulihan dari COVID-19 telah diikuti dengan ujian positif untuk koronavirus pada suatu tarikh yang telah dilaporkan.
en-mt: Immunity is seen as possible, based on the behavior of other coronaviruses, but in cases where recovery from COVID-19 has been followed by a positive test for coronavirus on a date that has been reported.

sourceString: These cases are believed to be worsening of a lingering infection rather than re-infection.
targetString: Semua kes ini dipercayai menjadi lebih buruk dengan jangkitan berpanjangan berbanding jangkitan semula.
en-mt: All of these cases are believed to be worse with prolonged infection than with re-infection.

sourceString: The virus is thought to be natural and have an animal origin, through spillover infection.
targetString: Virus dianggap semula jadi dan berasal daripada haiwan, menerusi jangkitan limpahan.
en-mt: Viruses are considered natural and come from animals, through spillover infection.

sourceString: The actual origin is unknown, but by December 2019 the spread of infection was almost entirely driven by human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Asal sebenar tidak diketahui tetapi sehingga Disember 2019 penularan jangkitan keseluruhannya hampir kesemuanya dipacu menerusi pemindahan dari manusia ke manusia.
en-mt: The exact origin is unknown but until December 2019 the transmission of the infection was almost entirely driven by human-to-human transmission.

sourceString: A study of the first 41 cases of confirmed COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, revealed the earliest date of onset of symptoms as 1 December 2019.
targetString: Satu kajian untuk 41 kes pertama COVID-19 yang disahkan, diterbitkan pada Januari 2020 dalam The Lancet, mendedahkan tarikh permulaan terawal gejala ialah pada 1 Disember 2019.
en-mt: A study of the first 41 confirmed cases of COVID-19, published in January 2020 in The Lancet, revealed the earliest date of onset of symptoms was December 1, 2019.

sourceString: Official publications from the WHO reported the earliest onset of symptoms as 8 December 2019.
targetString: Penerbitan rasmi daripada WHO melaporkan permulaan terawal gejala ialah pada 8 Disember 2019.
en-mt: An official publication from the WHO reports the earliest onset of symptoms to be on December 8, 2019.

sourceString: Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: Beberapa langkah biasanya digunakan untuk mengukur kadar kematian.
en-mt: Several measures are commonly used to measure mortality rates.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak and population characteristics such as age, sex and overall health.
targetString: Angka-angka ini berbeza mengikut wilayah dan mengikut masa dan dipengaruhi oleh jumlah ujian, kualiti sistem penjagaan kesihatan, pilihan rawatan, tempoh sejak penularan awal dan ciri-ciri populasi seperti umur, jantina dan kesihatan keseluruhan.
en-mt: These figures vary by region and over time and are influenced by the number of tests, the quality of the health care system, treatment options, length of time since initial transmission and population characteristics such as age, gender and overall health.

sourceString: In late 2019, WHO assigned the emergency ICD-10 disease codes U07.1 for deaths from lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 for deaths from clinically or epidemiologically diagnosed COVID-19 without lab-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: Pada hujung 2019, WHO menetapkan kod penyakit ICD-10 kecemasan U07.1 untuk kematian dari jangkitan SARS-CoV-2 yang disahkan makmal dan U07.2 untuk kematian dari jangkitan SARS-CoV-2 tanpa pengesahan makmal COVID-19 yang didiagnosis secara klinikal atau epidemiologi. Nisbah kematian berbanding kes mencerminkan jumlah kematian dibahagikan dengan jumlah kes yang didiagnosis dalam selang waktu yang diberikan.
en-mt: At the end of 2019, the WHO designated the emergency ICD-10 disease code U07.1 for death from laboratory-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and U07.2 for death from SARS-CoV-2 infection without laboratory confirmation of clinically diagnosed COVID-19 or epidemiology. The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases in a given time interval.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of 17 April 2020.
targetString: Berdasarkan statistik Johns Hopkins University, nisbah kematian berbanding kes global ialah 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) setakat 17 April 2020.
en-mt: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the ratio of deaths to global cases is 6.9% (153,822/2,240,191) as of April 17, 2020.

sourceString: The number varies by region.Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed individuals who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: Jumlah berbeza mengikut wilayah. Langkah-langkah lain termasuk kadar kematian kes (CFR), yang mencerminkan peratusan individu yang didiagnosis meninggal dunia dari penyakit, dan kadar kematian jangkitan (IFR) yang mencerminkan peratusan individu yang dijangkiti (didiagnosis dan tidak didiagnosis) yang meninggal dunia akibat penyakit.
en-mt: The amount varies by region. Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percentage of diagnosed individuals who die of the disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR) which reflects the percentage of infected individuals (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die of the disease.

sourceString: These statistics are not time bound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: Statistik ini tidak tertakluk pada masa dan menuruti populasi tertentu dari jangkitan sehingga penyelesaian kes.
en-mt: These statistics are not subject to time and follow a specific population from infection to case resolution.

sourceString: While not all infected people develop antibodies, the presence of antibodies may provide information about how many people have been infected.
targetString: Sementara bukan semua orang membangunkan antibodi, kehadiran antibodi mungkin menyediakan maklumat tentang jumlah orang yang dijangkiti.
en-mt: While not everyone develops antibodies, the presence of antibodies may provide information about how many people are infected.

sourceString: In the epicentre of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, a small village of 4600, 80 (1.7%) are already dead.
targetString: Di pusat penularan wabak di Itali, Castiglione d'Adda, desa kecil seramai 4600, 80 (1.7%) sudah meninggal dunia.
en-mt: In the epicenter of the outbreak in Italy, Castiglione d'Adda, a small village of 4600, 80 (1.7%) have died.

sourceString: In Gangelt, the disease was spread by Carnival festivals, and spread to younger people, causing a relatively lower mortality, and not all COVID-19 deaths may have been formally classified as such.
targetString: Di Gangelt, penyakit disebarkan oleh pesta Carnival, dan penularan kepada orang lebih muda, menyebabkan kadar kematian lebih rendah secara perbandingan, dan bukan semua kematian COVID-19 dikelaskan secara rasmi begitu.
en-mt: In Gangelt, the disease was spread by Carnival, and transmission to younger people, resulting in a comparatively lower death rate, and not all COVID-19 deaths were officially classified as such.

sourceString: Furthermore, the German health system has not been overwhelmed.
targetString: Tambahan lagi, sistem kesihatan Jerman masih belum keterlaluan.
en-mt: Furthermore, the German health system is still not overpowered.

sourceString: In the Netherlands, about 3% may have antibodies, as assessed from blood donors.
targetString: Di Belanda, sekurang-kurangnya 3% mungkin mempunyai antibodi seperti yang dinilai dari penderma darah.
en-mt: In the Netherlands, at least 3% may have antibodies as assessed from blood donors.

sourceString: 69 (0.004% of the population) have been confirmed to have died from COVID-19.
targetString: 69 (0.004% populasi) disahkan meninggal dunia akibat COVID-19.
en-mt: 69 (0.004% of the population) were confirmed to have died due to COVID-19.

sourceString: The impact of the pandemic and its mortality rate are different for men and women.
targetString: Impak pandemik dan kadar kematiannya berbeza untuk lelaki dan perempuan.
en-mt: The pandemic's impact and mortality rates differ for men and women.

sourceString: Mortality is higher in men in studies conducted in China and Italy.
targetString: Kadar kematian lebih tinggi untuk lelaki dalam kajian dilaksanakan di China dan Itali.
en-mt: Death rates were higher for men in studies conducted in China and Italy.

sourceString: The highest risk for men is in their 50s, with the gap between men and women closing only at 90.
targetString: Risiko tertinggi untuk lelaki ialah mereka dalam umur 50an, dengan jurang antara lelaki dan perempuan merapati hanya pada umur 90 tahun.
en-mt: The highest risk for men is in their 50s, with the gap between men and women narrowing only at age 90.

sourceString: In China, the death rate was 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.
targetString: Di China, kadar kematian ialah 2.8 peratus untuk lelaki dan 1.7 peratus untuk perempuan.
en-mt: In China, the death rate is 2.8 percent for men and 1.7 percent for women.

sourceString: The exact reasons for this sex-difference is not known, but genetic and behavioural factors could be a reason.
targetString: Sebab-sebab sebenar untuk perbezaan seks ini tidak diketahui tetapi faktor-faktor genetik dan tingkah laku mungkin menjadi sebab.
en-mt: The exact reasons for these sex differences are unknown but genetic and behavioral factors may be the cause.

sourceString: Sex-based immunological differences, lesser prevalence of smoking in women and men developing co-morbid conditions such as hypertension at a younger age than women could have contributed to the higher mortality in men.
targetString: Perbezaan imunologi berdasarkan seks, kekurangan kelaziman merokok dalam perempuan dan lelaki membentuk keadaan morbid bersama seperti hipertensi pada usia lebih muda daripada perempuan mungkin boleh menyumbang pada kadar kematian lebih tinggi dalam lelaki.
en-mt: Immunological differences based on sex, the lack of prevalence of smoking in women and men forming co-morbid conditions such as hypertension at a younger age than women may contribute to the higher mortality rate in men.

sourceString: In Europe, 57% of the infected individuals were men and 72% of those died with COVID-19 were men.
targetString: Di Eropah, 57% individu yang dijangkiti ialah lelaki dan 72% daripada jumlah yang meninggal dunia disebabkan COVID-19 ialah lelaki.
en-mt: In Europe, 57% of infected individuals are men and 72% of the total deaths due to COVID-19 are men.

sourceString: As of April 2020, the US government is not tracking sex-related data of COVID-19 infections.
targetString: Setakat April 2020, kerajaan AS tidak menjejak data berkaitan seks untuk jangkitan COVID-19.
en-mt: As of April 2020, the US government does not track sex-related data for COVID-19 infections.

sourceString: Research has shown that viral illnesses like Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS affect men and women differently.
targetString: Penyelidikan menunjukkan bahawa penyakit birus seperti Ebola, HIV, influenza dan SARS memberi kesan berbeza pada lelaki dan perempuan.
en-mt: Research shows that viral diseases such as Ebola, HIV, influenza and SARS affect men and women differently.

sourceString: A higher percentage of health workers, particularly nurses, are women, and they have a higher chance of being exposed to the virus.
targetString: Peratusan lebih tinggi pekerja kesihatan, terutamanya jururawat, ialah perempuan dan mereka mempunyai pendedahan yang lebih tinggi terhadap virus.
en-mt: A higher percentage of health workers, especially nurses, are female and they have a higher exposure to the virus.

sourceString: The World Health Organization announced on 11 February 2020 that the official name of the disease would be "COVID-19".
targetString: Pertubuhan Kesihatan Sedunia mengumumkan pada 11 Februari 2020 bahawa nama rasmi penyakit ini ialah "COVID-19".
en-mt: The World Health Organization announced on February 11, 2020 that the official name of this disease is "COVID-19".

sourceString: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explained that CO stands for corona, VI for virus, D for disease, and 19 for when the outbreak was first identified: 31 December 2019.
targetString: Ketua WHO Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus menjelaskan bahawa singkatan CO untuk korona, VI untuk virus, D untuk penyakit dan 19 untuk waktu wabak dikenal pasti kali pertama: 31 Disember 2019.
en-mt: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus explained that the abbreviations CO for corona, VI for virus, D for disease and 19 for epidemic time were identified for the first time: December 31, 2019.

sourceString: The name had been chosen to avoid references to a specific geographical location (e.g. China), animal species or group of people, in line with international recommendations for naming aimed at preventing stigmatisation.The virus that causes COVID-19 is named severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
targetString: Nama dipilih untuk mengelak rujukan pada lokasi geografi tertentu (cth. China), spesies haiwan atau kumpulan orang ramai, selaras dengan pengesyoran antarabangsa untuk pemberian nama bertujuan untuk mengelak stigma. Virus yang menyebabkan COVID-19 dinamakan koronavirus sindrom respirasi akut teruk 2 (SARS-CoV-2).
en-mt: Names are chosen to avoid reference to specific geographic locations (eg China), animal species or groups of people, in line with international recommendations for naming to avoid stigma. The virus that causes COVID-19 is called severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

sourceString: The WHO additionally uses "the COVID-19 virus" and "the virus responsible for COVID-19" in public communications.
targetString: Secara tambahan WHO menggunakan "virus COVID-19" dan "virus bertanggungjawab untuk COVID-19) dalam komunikasi awam.
en-mt: Additionally WHO uses "virus COVID-19" and "the virus responsible for COVID-19) in public communications.

sourceString: Both the disease and virus are commonly referred to as "coronavirus".
targetString: Kedua-dua penyakit dan virus biasanya dirujuk sebagai "koronavirus".
en-mt: Both the disease and the virus are commonly referred to as "coronavirus".

sourceString: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, the virus and disease were commonly referred to as "coronavirus" and "Wuhan coronavirus".
targetString: Semasa penularan awal di Wuhan, China, virus dan penyakit biasanya dirujuk sebagai "koronavirus" dan "koronavirus Wuhan".
en-mt: During the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China, the virus and disease were commonly referred to as "coronavirus" and "Wuhan coronavirus".

sourceString: In January 2020, WHO recommended 2019-nCov and 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease as interim names for the virus and disease in accordance with 2015 guidance against using locations in disease and virus names.
targetString: Pada Januari 2020, WHO mengesyorkan 2019-nCov dan penyakit respirasi akut 2019-nCoV sebagai nama sementara untuk virus dan penyakit selaras dengan panduan 2015 terhadap penggunaan lokasi untuk penyakit dan nama virus.
en-mt: In January 2020, WHO recommended 2019-nCov and 2019-nCoV acute respiratory disease as provisional names for the virus and disease in line with the 2015 guidance on the use of location for disease and virus names.

sourceString: The official names COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were issued on 11 February 2020.
targetString: Nama rasmi COVID-19 dan SARS-CoV-2 diumumkan pada 11 Februari 2020.
en-mt: The official names of COVID-19 and SARS-CoV-2 were announced on February 11, 2020.

sourceString: Due to capacity limitations in the standard supply chains, some digital manufacturers are printing healthcare material such as nasal swabs and ventilator parts.
targetString: Disebabkan oleh batasan kapasiti dalam rantai bekalan standard, beberapa pengilang digital mengeluarkan bahan penjagaan kesihatan seperti swab hidung dan bahagian ventilator.
en-mt: Due to capacity limitations in the standard supply chain, some digital manufacturers produce healthcare items such as nasal swabs and ventilator parts.

sourceString: In one example, when an Italian hospital urgently required a ventilator valve, and the supplier was unable to deliver in the timescale required, a local startup reverse-engineered and printed the required 100 valves overnight.
targetString: Dalam satu contoh, apabila hospital Itali memerlukan segera injap ventilator, dan pembekal tidak boleh menghantarnya dalam skala masa yang diperlukan, satu pemula kejuruteraan berbalik tempatan dan menghasilkan 100 injap yang diperlukan semalaman.
en-mt: In one example, when an Italian hospital urgently needed ventilator valves, and suppliers could not deliver them in the required timescale, an engineering start-up turned around locally and produced the 100 valves needed overnight.

sourceString: After the initial outbreak of COVID-19, conspiracy theories, misinformation and disinformation emerged regarding the origin, scale, prevention, treatment and other aspects of the disease and rapidly spread online.
targetString: Selepas penularan awal COVID-19, teori konspirasi, salah maklumat dan maklumat tidak betul muncul berkaitan asal usul, skala, pencegahan, rawatan dan aspek lain penyakit dan menyebar atas talian dengan cepat.
en-mt: After the initial outbreak of COVID-19, conspiracy theories, misinformation and misinformation emerged regarding the origin, scale, prevention, treatment and other aspects of the disease and spread online quickly.

sourceString: Humans appear to be capable of spreading the virus to some other animals.
targetString: Manusia berkemampuan untuk menyebarkan virus kepada beberapa haiwan yang lain.
en-mt: Humans are capable of spreading the virus to several other animals.

sourceString: The study failed to find evidence of viral replication in pigs, ducks, and chickens.
targetString: Kajian gagal untuk mencari bukti peniruan virus dalam khinzir, itik dan ayam.
en-mt: The study failed to find evidence of virus replication in pigs, ducks and chickens.

sourceString: No medications or vaccine is approved to treat the disease.
targetString: Tiada ubat-ubatan atau vaksin diluluskan untuk merawat penyakit.
en-mt: There are no drugs or vaccines approved to treat the disease.

sourceString: International research on vaccines and medicines in COVID-19 are underway by government organisations, academic groups and industry researchers.
targetString: Penyelidikan antarabangsa mengenai vaksin dan ubat-ubatan COVID-19 sedang diusahakan oleh organisasi kerajaan, kumpulan akademik dan penyelidik industri.
en-mt: International research into COVID-19 vaccines and drugs is being pursued by government organizations, academic groups and industry researchers.

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: Pada bulan Mac, Pertubuhan Kesihatan Dunia memulakan "Percubaan SOLIDARITY" untuk menilai kesan rawatan empat sebatian antivirus semasa dengan keberkesanan yang paling boleh diharapkan.
en-mt: In March, the World Health Organization initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" to evaluate the treatment effects of the four current antiviral compounds with the most promising efficacy.

sourceString: There is no available vaccine, but various agencies are actively developing vaccine candidates.
targetString: Tiada vaksin boleh didapati tetapi pelbagai agensi sedang membangunkan calon vaksin secara aktif.
en-mt: No vaccine is available but various agencies are actively developing vaccine candidates.

sourceString: Previous work on SARS-CoV is being utilised because SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 both use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells.
targetString: Usaha sebelum ini ke atas SARS-CoV sedang digunakan kerana SARS-CoV dan SARS-CoV-2 menggunakan reseptor ACE2 untuk memasuki sel manusia.
en-mt: Previous efforts on SARS-CoV are being used because SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 use the ACE2 receptor to enter human cells.

sourceString: There are three vaccination strategies being investigated.
targetString: Terdapat tiga strategi pemvaksinan sedang disiasat.
en-mt: There are three vaccination strategies under investigation.

sourceString: First, researchers aim to build a whole virus vaccine.
targetString: Pertama, penyelidik menyasarkan untuk membina vaksin virus secara keseluruhan.
en-mt: First, researchers aim to develop a vaccine for the virus as a whole.

sourceString: The use of such a virus, be it inactive or dead, aims to elicit a prompt immune response of the human body to a new infection with COVID-19.
targetString: Penggunaan virus berkenaan sama ada tidak aktif atau mati, bertujuan untuk memperoleh tindakan balas imun segera pada tubuh manusia terhadap jangkitan baharu dengan COVID-19.
en-mt: The use of the virus in question, either inactive or dead, aims to elicit an immediate immune response in the human body against a new infection with COVID-19.

sourceString: A second strategy, subunit vaccines, aims to create a vaccine that sensitises the immune system to certain subunits of the virus.
targetString: Strategi kedua, vaksin subunit, bertujuan untuk mencipta vaksin yang peka dengan sistem imun pada sesetengah subunit virus.
en-mt: The second strategy, subunit vaccines, aims to create a vaccine that sensitizes the immune system to some subunits of the virus.

sourceString: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, such research focuses on the S-spike protein that helps the virus intrude the ACE2 enzyme receptor.
targetString: Dalam kes SARS-CoV-2, penyelidikan tersebut menumpukan pada protein pepaku S yang membantu virus menceroboh reseptor enzim ACE2.
en-mt: In the case of SARS-CoV-2, the research focused on the S spike protein that helps the virus invade the ACE2 enzyme receptor.

sourceString: A third strategy is that of the nucleic acid vaccines (DNA or RNA vaccines, a novel technique for creating a vaccination).
targetString: Strategi ketiga ialah vaksin asid nukleik (vaksin DNA atau RNA, teknik novel untuk mencipta satu pemvaksinan).
en-mt: A third strategy is nucleic acid vaccines (DNA or RNA vaccines, a novel technique for creating a vaccination).

sourceString: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies would have to be tested for safety and efficacy.On 16 March 2020, the first clinical trial of a vaccine started with four volunteers in Seattle.
targetString: Vaksin eksperimen dari mana-mana strategi ini perlu diuji untuk keselamatan dan keberkesanan. Pada 16 Mac 2020, percubaan klinikal pertama vaksin bermula dengan empat sukarelawan di Seattle.
en-mt: Experimental vaccines from any of these strategies need to be tested for safety and efficacy. On March 16, 2020, the first clinical trial of the vaccine began with four volunteers in Seattle.

sourceString: The vaccine contains a harmless genetic code copied from the virus that causes the disease.Antibody dependent enhancement has been suggested as a potential challenge for vaccine development for SARS-COV-2, but this is controversial.
targetString: Vaksin mengandungi kod genetik tidak berbahaya disalin dari virus yang menyebabkan penyakit. Peningkatan kebergantungan antibodi dicadangkan sebagai cabaran berpotensi untuk pembangunan vaksin SARS-COV-2, tetapi hal ini suatu kontroversi.
en-mt: Vaccines contain harmless genetic code copied from viruses that cause disease. Increased antibody dependence has been proposed as a potential challenge for SARS-COV-2 vaccine development, but this is controversial.

sourceString: There are more than 300 active clinical trials underway as of April 2020.
targetString: Terdapat lebih daripada 300 percubaan klinikal aktif sedang dilaksanakan setakat bulan April 2020.
en-mt: There are more than 300 active clinical trials underway as of April 2020.

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating already approved treatments for malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.
targetString: Tujuh percubaan dinilai sudah diluluskan sebagai rawatan untuk malaria, termasuk empat kajian ke atas hidroksichloroquine atau chloroquine.
en-mt: Seven evaluated trials have already been approved as treatments for malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with nine phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: Ubat antivirus yang diubah tujuan meliputi kebanyakan penyelidikan China, dengan sembilan percubaan fasa III ke atas remdesivir untuk beberapa negara perlu dilaporkan menjelang hujung bulan April.
en-mt: Repurposed antiviral drugs account for most of the Chinese research, with nine phase III trials of remdesivir for several countries due to be reported by the end of April.

sourceString: A dynamic review of clinical development for COVID-19 vaccine and drug candidates was in place, as of April 2020.Several existing antiviral medications are being evaluated for treatment of COVID-19, including remdesivir, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir and lopinavir/ritonavir combined with interferon beta.
targetString: Satu semakan dinamik pembangunan klinikal untuk vaksin COVID-19 dan calon ubat disediakan, setakat April 2020. Beberapa ubat antivirus semasa sedang dinilai untuk rawatan COVID-19, termasuk remdesivir, chloroquine dan hidroksichloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir dan lopinavir/ritonavir bergabung dengan interferon beta.
en-mt: A dynamic review of clinical development for COVID-19 vaccines and drug candidates is available, as of April 2020. Several antiviral drugs are currently being evaluated for the treatment of COVID-19, including remdesivir, chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine, lopinavir/ritonavir and lopinavir/ritonavir combined with interferon beta.

sourceString: There is tentative evidence for efficacy by remdesivir, as of March 2020.
targetString: Terdapat bukti tentatif untuk keberkesanan oleh remdesivir setakat Mach 2020.
en-mt: There is tentative evidence for the efficacy of remdesivir as of March 2020.

sourceString: Clinical improvement was observed in patients treated with compassionate-use remdesivir.
targetString: Peningkatan klinikal diperhatikan dalam pesakit yang dirawat dengan penggunaan remdesivir secara penyayang.
en-mt: Clinical improvement was observed in patients treated with conservative use of remdesivir.

sourceString: Phase III clinical trials are being conducted in the US, China and Italy.Chloroquine, previously used to treat malaria, was studied in China in February 2020, with preliminary results.
targetString: Percubaan klinikal Fasa III dilakukan di AS, China dan Itali. Chloroquine, digunakan untuk merawat malaria sebelum ini dikaji di China pada bulan Februari 2020, memberikan keputusan awal.
en-mt: Phase III clinical trials are being conducted in the US, China and Italy. Chloroquine, used to treat malaria was previously studied in China in February 2020, giving preliminary results.

sourceString: However, there are calls for peer review of the research.
targetString: Bagaimanapun, terdapat panggilan untuk kajian semula setara penyelidikan.
en-mt: However, there are calls for a peer review of the research.

sourceString: Korean and Chinese Health Authorities recommend the use of chloroquine.
targetString: Pihak Berkuasa Korea dan Chin mengesyorkan penggunan chloroquine.
en-mt: Korean and Chin authorities recommend the use of chloroquine.

sourceString: However, the Wuhan Institute of Virology, while recommending a daily dose of one gram, notes that twice that dose is highly dangerous and could be lethal.
targetString: Bagaimanapun, Wuhan Institute of Virology, sementara mengesyorkan dos harian sebanyak satu gram, mengakui bahawa dua kali ganda dos sangat berbahaya dan boleh membawa maut.
en-mt: However, the Wuhan Institute of Virology, while recommending a daily dose of one gram, admits that doubling the dose is extremely dangerous and can be fatal.

sourceString: On 28 March 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorisation for hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine at the discretion of physicians treating people with COVID-19.The Chinese 7th edition guidelines also include interferon, ribavirin or umifenovir for use against COVID-19.
targetString: Pada 28 Mac 2020, FDA menerbitkan kebenaran penggunaan kecemasan untuk hidroksichloroquine dan chloroquine mengikut budi bicara pakar perubatan merawat mereka yang dijangkiti COVID-19. Garis panduan edisi ke-7 China juga termasuk interferon, ribavirin atau umifenovir untuk digunakan melawan COVID-19.
en-mt: On March 28, 2020, the FDA issued an emergency use authorization for hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine at the discretion of physicians treating those infected with COVID-19. China's 7th edition guidelines also include interferon, ribavirin or umifenovir for use against COVID-19.

sourceString: Preliminary data indicate that high doses of ribavirin are necessary to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.
targetString: Data awal menunjukkan bahawa dos ribavirin yang tinggi adalah perlu untuk merencat SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.
en-mt: Preliminary data suggest that high doses of ribavirin are necessary to inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro.

sourceString: Nitazoxanide has been recommended for further in vivo study after demonstrating low concentration inhibition of SARS-CoV-2.Studies have demonstrated that initial spike protein priming by transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) is essential for entry of SARS-CoV-2 via interaction with the ACE2 receptor.
targetString: Nitazoxanide disyorkan untuk kajian in vivo lanjutan selepas menunjukkan perencatan kepekatan rendah pada SARS-CoV-2. Kajian menunjukkan bahawa penyebuan protein peningkatan awal oleh serina protease transmembran 2 (TMPRSS2) penting untuk kemasukan SARS-CoV-2 menerusi interaksi dengan reseptor ACE2.
en-mt: Nitazoxanide was recommended for further in vivo studies after showing low concentration inhibition on SARS-CoV-2. Studies show that priming of the early enhancer protein by transmembrane protease serine 2 (TMPRSS2) is important for entry of SARS-CoV-2 through interaction with the ACE2 receptor.

sourceString: The studies of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine with or without azithromycin have major limitations that have prevented the medical community from embracing these therapies without further study.Oseltamivir does not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro and has no known role in COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: Kajian chloroquine dan hidroksichloroquine bersama atau tanpa azithromycin mempunyai batasan utama yang menghalang komuniti perubatan daripada menggunakan terapi ini tanpa kajian lanjutan. Oseltamivir tidak merencat SARS-CoV-2 in vitro dan tiada peranan diketahui dalam rawatan COVID-19.
en-mt: Studies of chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine with or without azithromycin have major limitations that prevent the medical community from using these therapies without further studies. Oseltamivir does not inhibit SARS-CoV-2 in vitro and has no known role in the treatment of COVID-19.

sourceString: Cytokine storm can be a complication in the later stages of severe COVID-19.
targetString: Ribut sitokin boleh menjadi komplikasi dalam peringkat seterusnya untuk COVID-19 yang teruk.
en-mt: Cytokine storm can be a complication in the later stages of severe COVID-19.

sourceString: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine may have anti-cytokine storm properties.Tocilizumab has been included in treatment guidelines by China's National Health Commission after a small study was completed.
targetString: Terdapat bukti bahawa hidroksichloroquine mempunyai sifat ribut antisitokin. Tocilizumab telah dimasukkan dalam garis panduan rawatan oleh Suruhanjaya Kesihatan Kebangsaan China selepas kajian kecil diselesaikan.
en-mt: There is evidence that hydroxychloroquine has anticytokine storm properties. Tocilizumab was included in the treatment guidelines by the National Health Commission of China after a small study was completed.

sourceString: It is undergoing a phase 2 non randomised test at the national level in Italy after showing positive results in people with severe disease.
targetString: Ia sedang menjalani ujian bukan rawak fasa 2 pada peringkat kebangsaan di Itali selepas menunjukkan keputusan positif dengan penyakit teruk.
en-mt: It is undergoing a phase 2 non-randomized trial at the national level in Italy after showing positive results in severe disease.

sourceString: Combined with a serum ferritin blood test to identify cytokine storms, it is meant to counter such developments, which are thought to be the cause of death in some affected people.
targetString: Digabungkan dengan ujian darah feritin serum untuk mengenal pasti ribut sitokin, ini bermaksud untuk melawan perkembangan tersebut, yang dianggap sebagai punca kematian bagi beberapa orang yang dijangkiti.
en-mt: Combined with a serum ferritin blood test to identify the cytokine storm, this is meant to combat the development, which is thought to be the cause of death for some infected people.

sourceString: The interleukin-6 receptor antagonist was approved by the FDA based on retrospective case studies for treatment of steroid refractory cytokine release syndrome induced by a different cause, CAR T cell therapy, in 2017.
targetString: Antagonis reseptor interleukin-6 diluluskan oleh FDA berdasarkan pada kajian kes retrospektif untuk rawatan sindrom pembebasan sitokin refraktori steroid teraruh oleh sebab berlainan, terapi sel CAR T pada tahun 2017.
en-mt: An interleukin-6 receptor antagonist was approved by the FDA based on a retrospective case study for the treatment of steroid-refractory cytokine release syndrome induced by different causes, CAR T cell therapy in 2017.

sourceString: To date, there is no randomised, controlled evidence that tocilizumab is an efficacious treatment for CRS.
targetString: Sehingga kini, tiada bukti secara rawak terkawal bahawa tocilizumab ialah rawatan berkesan untuk CRS.
en-mt: To date, there is no randomized controlled evidence that tocilizumab is an effective treatment for CRS.

sourceString: Transferring purified and concentrated antibodies produced by the immune systems of those who have recovered from COVID-19 to people who need them is being investigated as a non-vaccine method of passive immunisation.
targetString: Memindahkan antibodi ditulenkan dan pekat yang dihasilkan oleh sistem imun mereka yang sembuh dari COVID-19 kepada orang yang memerlukannya sedang disiasat sebagai kaedah bukan vaksin untuk imunisasi pasif.
en-mt: Transferring purified and concentrated antibodies produced by the immune systems of those recovering from COVID-19 to people who need them is being investigated as a non-vaccine method of passive immunization.

sourceString: This strategy was tried for SARS with inconclusive results.
targetString: Strategi ini dicuba pada SARS dengan tiada keputusan konklusif.
en-mt: This strategy was tried on SARS with no conclusive results.

sourceString: Viral neutralisation is the anticipated mechanism of action by which passive antibody therapy can mediate defence against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Neutralisasi virus ialah mekanisme tindakan terjangka iaitu terapi antibodi pasif boleh menjadi pengantara pertahanan melawan SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Virus neutralization is a putative mechanism of action whereby passive antibody therapy may mediate defense against SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: Other mechanisms however, such as antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity and/or phagocytosis, may be possible.
targetString: Mekanisme lain bagaimanapun, seperti kesitotoksikan selular kebergantungan antibodi dan/atau fagositosis yang berkemungkinan.
en-mt: Other mechanisms however, such as antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity and/or phagocytosis are possible.

sourceString: Other forms of passive antibody therapy, for example, using manufactured monoclonal antibodies, are in development.
targetString: Bentuk lain terapi antibodi pasif, contohnya, menggunakan antibodi monoklon dihasilkan berada dalam pembangunan.
en-mt: Other forms of passive antibody therapy, for example, using produced monoclonal antibodies are in development.

sourceString: Production of convalescent serum, which consists of the liquid portion of the blood from recovered patients and contains antibodies specific to this virus, could be increased for quicker deployment.
targetString: Pengeluaran serum pemulihan, yang terdiri daripada bahagian cecair darah daripada pesakit yang pulih dan mengandungi antibodi khusus pada virus ini boleh ditingkatkan untuk pelaksanaan lebih cepat.
en-mt: Production of convalescent serum, which consists of a liquid portion of blood from recovered patients and contains antibodies specific to the virus can be scaled up for faster execution.

sourceString: Coronavirus diseases, a group of closely related syndromes
targetString: Penyakit koronavirus, satu kumpulan sindrom berkaitan rapat.
en-mt: The coronavirus disease, a group of closely related syndromes.

sourceString: Li Wenliang, a doctor at Central Hospital of Wuhan, who later contracted and died of COVID-19 after raising awareness of the spread of the virus.
targetString: Li Wenliang, seorang doktor di Central Hospital of Wuhan, kemudiannya dijangkiti dan meninggal dunia disebabkan oleh COVID-19 selepas menimbulkan kesedaran tentang penularan virus.
en-mt: Li Wenliang, a doctor at the Central Hospital of Wuhan, was later infected and died due to COVID-19 after raising awareness about the spread of the virus.
